meanings.definition: To arrange or divide into layers
meanings.sent1: I will stratify the cake layers with frosting.
meanings.sent2: The geologist explained how rocks stratify over time.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to stratify the ingredients like a delicious sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The artist used different colors to stratify the painting, creating depth.
meanings.sent5: In the experiment, we observed how liquids naturally stratify based on density.

meanings.definition: To separate into different social classes or levels
meanings.sent1: The school principal wanted to stratify the students based on their academic performance.
meanings.sent2: The caste system in ancient societies was designed to stratify people into distinct groups.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer decided to stratify the models by their height, creating an interesting runway show.
meanings.sent4: The political system seemed to stratify the population, leading to inequality.
meanings.sent5: The company's policies unintentionally stratify employees, causing tension in the workplace.
